conclusion: Analyze the flow of liquid through the system of baffles and containers to predict which container (E or F) the liquid will flow into.
Arrows labeled A, B, C, and D indicate the direction of liquid flow.
Deducing the path of the liquid through the baffles and into the containers from the arrows.
Trace the path the liquid takes through the baffles and into container E or F starting from A, B, C, or D.
Identify the starting point of the liquid flow from the arrow labeled A.
Follow the path indicated by the arrows from A to B, C, or D.
Determine the container that the liquid will flow into after passing through the baffles.
Since the liquid flows from A to E, it will flow into container E.
